intro: Hauya elegans subsp. barcenae, commonly known as the Barcena's elegant hauya, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
